title: Looking for a font that resembles theatre marquee letters
content:
Greetings everyone  
Searched far and wide and I haven't found an exact answer to this one so I thought I would post it to the forum  
What is the typeface used for movie theater marquee letters, such as these shown [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215140038/http:/flickr.com/photos/emily_paup/302756590/)? Looks like [FF Din](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215140038/http:/fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_din_ot_black/) is fairly close, but its curves seem to be a little flatter than those in the marquee letters; anyone have an exact match?  
Thanks in advance for any assistance!  
sno-man
author: snoqualmie7

comments.content:
[http://typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215140038/http:/typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html "http://typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html")

Gotham is closed but it's not it. Btw Gotham is based on these theather letters of New York, and stores and so on...

These letters wouldn't have been based on a "typeface" per se - they would have been created especially for this type of sign, so you probably won't find an exact match in a digital font. DIN is very close as you say.

- Lex
It isn't an exact match but [Now Playing](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215140038/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/sets/?CID=9) by Terminal Design is based on the lettering of the Apollo Theater.
